metadata.title: iMajor - Discover Your Perfect College Major
metadata.description: Take the free Major Exploration Quiz to discover how deeply you've explored your college major options. Interactive quizzes, curated resources, and guided exploration tasks.

hero.subheadline: Take our interactive quiz to discover which career categories align with your interests, skills, and goals.
hero.stickyNote: How can you love what you don't know

about.title: What is
about.description1: iMajor is a free platform designed to help students explore and understand their potential college majors. Through interactive quizzes, curated resources, and guided exploration tasks, we help you make confident decisions about your academic future.
about.description2: Whether you are just starting to think about college or finalizing your applications, iMajor provides the tools and insights you need to discover your perfect major and navigate the college application process with confidence.

features.title: Everything You Need to
features.subtitle: Comprehensive tools designed to help you navigate your college application journey

tasks.title: Exploration Tasks
tasks.description: Guided tasks to help you explore your major deeply. Complete them and you might even surpass some university students in knowledge!

careers.title: Career Paths
careers.description: Explore detailed information about salaries, skills, growth outlook, and more for each career.

resources.title: 10resources
resources.description: From must-read books to influential figures, accelerate your learning journey with curated resources.

collegetv.title: CollegeTV
collegetv.description: Watch curated videos to help you navigate college admissions, from application tips to student experiences.

tracker.title: Application Tracker
tracker.description: Your all-in-one college application hub. Track universities, manage tests (SAT/TOEFL), log activities, record honors, organize essays, and monitor recommendation letters.

why.title: Why
why.subtitle: Built by students, for students. We understand the challenges of college applications.

exploration.title: Major Exploration
exploration.description: Discover your path with guided quizzes and exploration tasks designed to help you understand what you truly want to study.

allInOne.title: All-in-One Platform
allInOne.description: Keep all your application materials in one place. Universities, essays, activities, tests - everything organized and accessible.

safe.title: Safe & Private
safe.description: Your data belongs to you. Admins cannot see your personal application materials like university lists, test scores, or essays.

free.title: Free
free.description: No hidden costs, no premium tiers, no paywalls. All features are completely free for every student.

noChaos.title: No More Chaos
noChaos.description: Say goodbye to scattered Notion pages, Google Docs, and spreadsheets. Everything in one clean, organized space.

growing.title: Growing Features
growing.description: We're constantly adding new tools and features based on student feedback. Your success drives our development.

contact.title: Let's
contact.subtitle: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you.

success.title: Message Sent!
success.description: Thank you for reaching out. We will get back to you soon.

footer.description: Your all-in-one platform for major exploration and college application management. Built by students, for students.

careerQuiz.title: Discover Your
careerQuiz.description: Answer 21 quick questions to find out which career categories match your interests, personality, and goals. Takes about 5 minutes.

results.title: Your Career Interests
results.description: Based on your answers, here are the career categories that match your interests

1.question: On a free weekend, which activity sounds most appealing?
options: Building or coding a personal project
Volunteering at a local clinic or care center
Analyzing stock trends or planning investments
Going on a nature hike and identifying plants/wildlife

2.question: Which type of documentary would you most likely watch?
options: The psychology behind human behavior
Legal battles that changed history
The creative process of famous artists
How viral content shapes public opinion

3.question: In a group project, you naturally tend to:
options: Handle the technical aspects and problem-solving
Make sure everyone's well-being is considered
Take charge of planning, budgets, and deadlines
Create the visual presentation and design elements

4.question: Which headline would grab your attention first?
options: New AI System Revolutionizes Problem-Solving
Breakthrough Treatment Shows Promise for Rare Disease
Climate Scientists Discover New Ecosystem Pattern
Supreme Court Decision Reshapes Civil Rights

5.question: Which headline would grab your attention first?
options: Study Reveals How Childhood Experiences Shape Adult Behavior
Startup Disrupts Industry with New Business Model
Artist's Unconventional Work Challenges Perceptions
Investigative Report Uncovers Hidden Truth

6.question: Which skill would you most like to master?
options: Programming or engineering design
Diagnosing problems and providing care
Negotiation and strategic planning
Scientific research methodology

7.question: Which skill would you most like to master?
options: Understanding and teaching complex concepts
Persuasive argumentation and debate
Visual composition and creative expression
Storytelling and public speaking

8.question: What kind of problems do you enjoy solving most?
options: Logical puzzles with clear right/wrong answers
Helping people navigate difficult situations
Finding win-win solutions in conflicts
Expressing complex ideas in engaging ways

9.question: Which work environment appeals to you most?
options: A tech lab or innovation workspace
A hospital, clinic, or research facility
A corporate office or trading floor
A courtroom or government building

10.question: Which work environment appeals to you most?
options: A school, university, or community center
A design studio or creative agency
A newsroom or production studio
A field research station or laboratory

11.question: What motivates you most in your work?
options: Creating efficient systems and innovations
Making a direct positive impact on people's lives
Building wealth and achieving financial success
Discovering new knowledge about the world

12.question: What motivates you most in your work?
options: Fighting for justice and fairness
Expressing creativity and beauty
Informing and connecting with audiences
Understanding human behavior and society

13.question: Which book topic would you pick up first?
options: The future of artificial intelligence
The science of human health and longevity
Strategies of successful entrepreneurs
Mysteries of the universe and nature

14.question: Which book topic would you pick up first?
options: How people learn and develop
Famous legal cases that changed society
The history of art movements
How media shapes culture and politics

15.question: If you could solve one global challenge, which would it be?
options: Advancing technology to solve resource problems
Eliminating diseases and improving healthcare access
Reducing poverty through economic development
Reforming systems to ensure justice for all

16.question: How do you prefer to express yourself?
options: Through data, code, or technical solutions
Through caring actions and support
Through strategic plans and presentations
Through visual art, music, or design

17.question: How do you prefer to express yourself?
options: Through teaching and mentoring others
Through well-reasoned arguments
Through writing and storytelling
Through research and analysis

18.question: What kind of legacy would you like to leave?
options: Inventions or systems that improve daily life
Lives saved or improved through care
A successful organization or financial empire
Scientific discoveries that advance human knowledge

19.question: What kind of legacy would you like to leave?
options: Students or communities you've helped develop
Laws or policies that created positive change
Art or designs that moved and inspired people
Stories or content that informed and entertained

20.question: Which compliment would mean the most to you?
options: "You're so innovative and technically brilliant"
"You have such a caring and healing presence"
"You have amazing business instincts"
"Your curiosity and analytical mind are incredible"

21.question: Which compliment would mean the most to you?
options: "You're such a patient and inspiring teacher"
"Your sense of justice is unwavering"
"Your creative vision is truly unique"
"You have a gift for connecting with audiences"
